data.title: Case Law Index: Packers and Stockyards Act
data.meta_description: Case Law Index Packers and Stockyards Act September 1, 1921 – November 9, 2023 This index provides a comprehensive though not...
data.text:
September 1, 1921 – November 9, 2023

This index provides a comprehensive though not necessarily exhaustive compilation of reported and unreported federal and state court decisions involving the Packers and Stockyards Act that were decided between the dates listed above. The cases are listed in reverse chronological order. The “Text” link goes to the freely available Google Scholar text of the opinion. These listings are for educational purposes only, and are not a substitute for legal counsel.

SUPREME COURT

Mahon v. Stowers, 416 U.S. 100, 94 S.Ct. 1626 (1974) (bankruptcy; priorities under the PSA) Text

Butz v. Glover Livestock Comm’n Co., 411 U.S. 182, 93 S.Ct. 1455 (1973) (antitrust; violation of the PSA) Text

Denver Union Stock Yard Co. v. Producers Livestock Mktg. Ass’n, 356 U.S. 282, 78 S.Ct. 738 (1958) (validity of company’s regulation under the PSA) Text

Swift & Co. v. United States, 316 U.S. 216, 62 S.Ct. 948 (1942) (charges for shipment of livestock) Text

United States v. Morgan, 313 U.S. 409, 61 S.Ct. 999 (1941) (market agencies’ services at stockyards) Text

Armour & Co. v. Alton R. Co., 312 U.S. 195, 61 S.Ct. 498 (1941) (breach of livestock delivery contract) Text

United States v. Morgan, 307 U.S. 183, 59 S.Ct. 795 (1939) (challenging the rate order of the Sec’y of Agric.) Text

Union Stock Yard & Transit Co. of Chicago v. United States, 308 U.S. 213, 60 S.Ct. 193 (1939) (“common carrier’s” rates under the Interstate Commerce Act) Text

Morgan v. United States, 304 U.S. 1, 58 S.Ct. 773 (1938) (challenging the rate order of the Sec’y of Agric.) Text

St. Joseph Stock Yards Co. v. United States, 98 U.S. 38, 56 S.Ct. 720 (1936) (Sec’y of Agric. authority to fix stockyard rates) Text

United States v. Corrick, 298 U.S. 435, 56 S.Ct. 829 (1936) (authority to fix the rates of market agencies) Text

Acker v. United States, 298 U.S. 426, 56 S.Ct. 824 (1936) (authority to fix the rates of market agencies) Text

Morgan v. United States, 98 U.S. 468, 56 S.Ct. 906 (1936) (challenging the rate order of the Secretary of Agric.) Text

Atchison, T. & S.F. Ry. Co. v. United States, 295 U.S. 193, 55 S.Ct. 748 (1935) (transportation of livestock to public stockyards; jurisdiction of the ICC) Text

Tagg Bros. & Moorhead v. United States, 280 U.S. 420, 50 S.Ct. 220 (1930) (authority to fix the rates of market agencies) Text

United States v. Am. Livestock Comm’n Co., 279 U.S. 435, 49 S.Ct. 425 (1929) (boycott of a livestock producers’ association by livestock companies) Text

First Circuit

In re Broiler Chicken Grower Antitrust Litig., 509 F. Supp. 3d 1359 (U.S. Jud. Pan. Mult. Lit. 2020) (Broiler chicken growers brough antitrust actions against poultry production companies under Sherman Act and PSA) Text

In re Coop de Consumidores del Noroeste, 464 B.R. 525 (Bankr. D.P.R. 2012) (timely notice; “cash sale” under PSA) Text

Milton Abeles, Inc. v. Creekstone Farms Premium Beef, LLC, No. 06-CV-3893 (JFB)(AKT), 2009 WL 875553 (E.D. N.Y. Mar. 30, 2009) (refusal to pay is deceptive practice) Text

Liberty Mut. Ins. Co. v. Rotches Pork Packers, Inc., 969 F.2d 1384 (2nd Cir. 1992) (statutory trust) Text

Liberty Mut. Ins. Co. v. Bankers Trust Co., 768 F. Supp. 70 (S.D. N.Y. 1991) (insurer’s motion for attorneys’ fees) Text

United States v. Perdue Farms, Inc., 680 F.2d 277 (2nd Cir. 1982) (slaughtered poultry activities of live poultry dealers) Text

Trunz Pork Stores, Inc. v. Wallace, 70 F.2d 688 (2nd Cir. 1934) (unfair practices and unreasonable preferences in commerce by packers) Text

THIRD CIRCUIT

FOURTH CIRCUIT

FIFTH CIRCUIT
